paragraph.value: We report the results on the full sets and on

tokens in Table 5 (part-of-speech tagging accuracy) For POS, the largest margins are in the Slavic languages (Russian, Czech, Bulgarian), where word order is relatively free and thus rich word representations are imperative. Chinese also exhibits impressive improvement across all settings, perhaps due to the large character inventory (>
), for which a model such as MIMICK can learn well-informed embeddings using the large Polyglot vocabulary dataset, overcoming both word- and characterlevel sparsity in the UD corpus.
